communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Data showing the budget of all costs associated with the widely publicized December 19, 2024 "perp walk" of Luigi Mangione upon entering New York City following extradition from Pennsylvania, including but not limited to:
- The cost of transportation via helicopter;
- The cost in man hours of all members of the security team assigned to walk with Mangione;
- An inventory and cost of all weapons used during the walk from the helicopter pad to the building;
- Any additional security detail costs associated with the presence of New York Mayor Eric Adams;
- Any other security or logistical costs related to the transportation of Luigi Mangione into NYCPD custody.

I am a lawyer and journalist and intend to use this information for educational purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebekah Rini, Esq.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting any all documents and emails associated with the following Freedom of Information Act requests: 

Request number 1589547 with the subject Eltex Trade LLP
Request number 1589611 with the subject Dackon LP
Request number 1589613 with the subject Balfern LP

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matt Bernardini
